abstract.p: Rolls-Royce of Britain receives estimated $1.5 billion offer to supply Singapore Airlines with engines for its superjumbo Airbus A3XX aircraft (S)

block.p: Securing an order that could be worth as much as $1.5 billion, Rolls-Royce of Britain beat GE/Pratt & Whitney in a deal to supply Singapore Airlines with the engines for its superjumbo Airbus A3XX aircraft. Last month, Singapore Airlines said it would spend $8.6 billion to buy 25 of the Airbus planes, giving the European consortium a crucial endorsement for the new aircraft, which can carry more passengers than Boeing's 747 models. The first of the new airplanes is scheduled to arrive in 2006.
